contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox sportsperson | headercolor = | name = Khalil Al-Hanahneh | image = | image_size = <!--Only for images narrower than 220 pixels.--> | caption = | birth_name = | fullname = | nickname = | nationality = Jordan {{flagicon|Jordan}} | residence = | birth_date = 1980 | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | height = <!-- {{convert|}} (yyyy) --> | weight = <!-- {{convert|}} (yyyy) --> | website = <!-- {{URL|www.example.com}} --> | country = | sport = [[Athletics (sport)|Athletics]] | event = | collegeteam = | club = | team = | turnedpro = | coach = | retired = | coaching = | worlds = | regionals = | nationals = | olympics = [[Athletics at the 2004 Summer Olympics – Men's 100 metres|2004]] & [[Athletics at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men's 200 metres|2008]] | paralympics = | highestranking = | pb = | medaltemplates = | show-medals = }} '''Khalil Al-Hanahneh''' (born May 11, 1980) is a [[Jordan|Jordanian]] athlete specialized in the [[100 metres]]. Al-Hanahneh participated in [[Athletics_at_the_2004_Summer_Olympics_%E2%80%93_Men%27s_100_metres|2004 Summer Olympics]] and [[Athletics at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men's 200 metres|2008 Summer Olympics]]. Al-Hanahneh has also represented his country at the [[2003 World Championships in Athletics – Men's 100 metres|2003 World Championship (100 metres)]], [[2007 World Championships in Athletics – Men's 200 metres|2007 World Championship (200 metres)]] and [[2009 World Championships in Athletics – Men's 200 metres|2009 World Championship (200 metres)]]. He won medals in the sprints at the [[Athletics at the 2007 Pan Arab Games|2007 Pan Arab Games]] and [[Athletics at the 2005 West Asian Games|2005 West Asian Games]] and was the [[bronze medal]]list over [[200 metres]] at the [[2007 Asian Athletics Championships]]. Participating in the [[2004 Summer Olympics]], he achieved sixth place in his 100 metres heat, thus failing to make it through to the second round. Al Hanahneh has set several [[Jordanian records in athletics|national records]], and ranked third in the [[Athletics at the 2007 Pan Arab Games|2007 Pan Arab Games]] in 100 m and second in [[200 metres]] where he qualified for the [[2008 Summer Olympics|2008 Olympics]].<ref>[http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2008-06/23/content_8424117.htm "Jordan to send seven athletes to Beijing Olympics"], Xinhua, June 23, 2008</ref> ==See also== * [[Athletics at the 2006 Asian Games – Results]] * [[Jordanian records in athletics]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{iaaf name|id=193880}} * [http://en.jordan-athletics.org/ Jordan Athletics Federation website] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Hanahneh, Khalil Al | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Jordanian sprinter | DATE OF BIRTH = May 11, 1980 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hanahneh, Khalil Al}} [[Category:1980 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Male sprinters]] [[Category:Jordanian athletes]] [[Category:Olympic athletes of Jordan]] [[Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2004 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2008 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2006 Asian Games]] {{Jordan-athletics-bio-stub}}
